spc package¶

Submodules¶

spc.global_fun module¶

Global functions, available to all classes

@author: Rohan Isaac

spc.global_fun.flag_bits(n)¶

Return the bits of a byte as a boolean array:

n (charater):
8-bit character passed
list (bool):
boolean list representing the bits in the byte (big endian) [‘most sig bit’, ... , ‘least sig bit’ ]
>>> flag_bits('A') # ASCII 65, Binary: 01000001
[False, True, False, False, False, False, False, True]
spc.global_fun.read_subheader(subheader)¶

Return the subheader as a list

subheader (string):
32 character string in the subheader format
list:
10 item list with the following data members: [0] subflgs [1] subexp [2] subindx [3] subtime [4] subnext [5] subnois [6] subnpts [7] subscan [8] subwlevel [9] subresv

spc.spc module¶

spc class: main class that starts loading data from Thermo Grams *.SPC file

@author: Rohan Isaac

class spc.spc.File(filename)¶

Starts loading the data from a .SPC spectral file using data from the header. Stores all the attributes of a spectral file:

content: Full raw data sub[i]: sub file object for each subfileFor each subfile

sub[i].y

x: x-data, global, or for the first subheader

>>> import spc
>>> ftir_1 = spc.File('/path/to/ftir.spc')
data_txt()¶

Returns x,y column data as a string variable, can be printed to standard output or fed to text file.

debug_info()¶

Interpret flags and header information to debug more about the file format

head_siz = 512¶
head_str = '<cccciddicccci9s9sh32s130s30siicchf48sfifc187s'¶
log_siz = 64¶
logstc_str = '<iiiii44s'¶
olast = None¶

self.oyear = int(self.oyear) # need to fix self.omonth = int(self.omonth) self.oday = int(self.oday) self.ohour = int(self.ohour) self.ominute = int(self.ominute)

old_head_siz = 256¶
old_head_str = '<cchfffcchcccc8shh28s130s30s32s'¶
plot()¶

Plots data, and use column headers

print_metadata()¶

Print out select metadata

set_exp_type()¶

Set the experiment type

set_labels()¶

Set the x, y, z axis labels using various information in file content

subhead1_pos = 544¶
subhead_siz = 32¶
write_file(path)¶

Output x,y data to text file tab seperated, with column headers Arguments ——— path: full path to output file including extension

spc.sub module¶

SubFile class: loads each subfile data segment into object

@author: Rohan Isaac

class spc.sub.subFile(data, fnpts, fexp, txyxy)¶

Processes each subfile passed to it, extracts header information and data information and places them in data members

x: x-data (optional) y: y-data y_int: integer y-data if y-data is not floating

class spc.sub.subFileOld(data, fnpts, fexp, txyxy)¶

Processes each subfile passed to it, extracts header information and data information and places them in data members. Used for the old format where the y-values are stored in an odd way

x: x-data (optional) y: y-data
